ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Ms.Rita Panicker was awarded the Lifetime Achievement Award 2016 by the National Association of Professional Social Workers in India for her distinct contribution in the domain of child rights, especially street & working children at the 4th Indian Social Work Congress.  Rita Panicker honoured by Shri Amitabh Bachan in the new Star Plus show Aaj Ki Raat Hai Zindagi 2015  Vanitha Woman of the Year 2013 by the Malayala Manorama group. Award instituted to acknowledge the work done by Malayali women to serve our society  IGSSS Shrestha Puruskar,2011, by the Indo Global Social Service Society in New Delhi for pioneering work in bringing significant changes in the lives of street and working children.  Nominated in 2009 for the "Right Livelihood Award" and was one of the finalists for the award.  Women of Social Work Excellence by Manava Seva Dharmasamvardhani Charitable Trust for Social Service Consciousness, Chennai, on 27 February 2002.  Childrens Development Khazana started by Butterflies in 2001 received the Second Prize in the 2006 Global Development Network Award for the Most Innovative Development Project. This award is given to the institution whose ongoing project embodies a fresh approach to an important development need and holds the greatest promise for benefiting the poor in developing and transition countries. Criteria include the degree of innovation and the potential for broad application of the project in other countries.  The Ramachandran Ikeda Award 1999 was conferred on Butterflies in appreciation of their work in education, healthcare and recreation of street and working children. The award was conferred on Butterflies for following Gandhian philosophy of education i.e. schools should be living school where children are taught life skills education, to respect work especially those who work with their hands and to respect and accept all irrespective of language, religion or caste.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: CARE INDIA: Since 1950, CARE in India has delivered high impact programmes benefiting more than 16 million people across 15 States and 3 Union Territories. CARE works in the fields of livelihood, health, education, disaster relief and rehabilitation and holistic development for vulnerable and marginalized communities. The major programs in India are operational in Jharkhand, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Orissa, Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal. CARE has a credible and consistent track record of delivering social and economic programmes, through strategic partnerships with the Government of India, civil society organisations, private sector organizations and international agencies. CARE in India has worked with major multilateral and bilateral organisations including UNDP, World Bank, USAID, DFID, USDA, and EC; institutional donors including Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, Elton John Foundation, State Bank of India (SBI), and Oracle among others. CARE has designed and implemented significant microfinance, micro enterprise and livelihood programmes in India, Asia and globally. CARE successfully designed and managed the DFID funded Credit and Savings for Household Enterprise (CASHE) to enhance the income and economic security of the poor rural women. CARE implemented the EU funded Sustainable Tribal Empowerment Project (STEP) aimed at improving the livelihood of poor tribal community by improving household income, access to services in health, education, and food security of 235,000 households in 4 districts of Andhra Pradesh. CARE is currently managing the implementation of USDA supported Sustainable Nutrition Education Health And Livelihoods (SNEHAL) to improve the livelihood security of occupationally marginalised groups in Gujarat through access to rights and entitlements, livelihood, health and education of the most vulnerable and hard to reach communities. CARE is also implementing the Tsunami Response Program (TRP) in Tamil Nadu to restore livelihoods of tsunami affected communities

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Child Survival India has an integrated community development approach with health education and gender as its major focus areas. Organisation is working on Primary Health Care maternal and child health HIV prevention and care women empowerment Legal literacy and formation of Mahila Panchayats Adolescent life skill education and vocational training and non formal education for street & working children. Child survival India has taken up a number of programs addressing the entire continuum of the HIV/AIDS problem from HIV prevention to community based care and support to people living with HIV/AIDS to palliative care for full blown AIDS. Over the years organization has partnered with various national and international agencies and other organizations like UNFPA CEDPA India HIV/ AIDS Alliance GATES Foundation and National Foundation of India etc. We are currently receiving support from state as well as central government. Delhi State AIDS Control society Department of women and child development Directorate of family Welfare Ministry of Health & family Welfare and Directorate of Education are supporting our programs. Transfer of Skills to Communities is one of the key strategies in Child Survival India s sustainability plan.The organization has actively worked on this issue and has tried to empower key populations of various programs to take the program activities forward. We have mobilized 1. A cadre of 27 key population facilitators have been trained in IPC skills and are currently conducting outreach with trucking population on STI and HIV prevention issues 2.140 community women from Delhi and Haryana have been trained as mahila Panchayat members who provide legal counseling and help in redressal of cases of women facing domestic violence and marital discord 3.17 peer educators from the High risk behavior group of female sex workers have been incapacitated in peer outreach . 4.24 peer leaders have been trained to work with adolescent girls & boys Male and female HIV infected individuals vulnerable women and men in reproductive age group on sexual and reproductive health and HIV/AIDS issues. 5.10 Persons Living with HIV/AIDS who have been associated with NGO for about 4 to 5 yrs have been trained to conduct positive speaking sessions in the general community so as to create awareness on HIV/AIDS reduce associated stigma and discrimination and to motivate people to go in for HIV testing.

This project titled Creating Education Opportunities for Children From the most marginalised Communities has been conceptualised to strengthen early years learning experiences of young children by having intervention in AWCs and schools. The project is running in North Delhi in 108 AWCs (AW Project- Timarpur) and 13 MCD Schools.

The project aims to work with children and their communities along with the educational service providers in schools. It aims to strengthen their capacities so that they are more resilient to disaster, climate change and everyday risks. The project intervention is in 60 schools along with 4 slum communities in South Delhi. The project targets the strengthening of Comprehensive School Safety Planning and Community Based Disaster Risk Reduction Planning.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The CII Foundation was set up by CII in 2011 to undertake a wide range of developmental and charitable activities and initiatives pan India by enabling Industry for infusing inclusive development. Few of our significant projects include: Addressing the Sanitation Challenge  Mission SoS In 2014, CII Foundation (CIIF) launched Mission Sanitation in Schools (SoS) to the address sanitation challenge and support the national agenda of Swachh Bharat. As part of the Mission, the Foundation has been undertaking various on-ground initiatives by engaging companies and communities, both in urban and rural India. A number of interventions have been undertaken as part of Mission SoS, which includes construction of toilet blocks in Govt. schools, model public toilets in urban spaces and behavior change projects in villages and slums to make them open defecation free. Recognizing and strengthening grassroot women leaders - Women Exemplar Program The Program, instituted in 2005, recognizes the contributions of women grassroots leaders, who have, against all odds, excelled and contributed significantly in the areas of Health, Education and Micro-enterprise. Each year, three extraordinary leaders are recognized as Woman Exemplars from among over hundred applications. In addition to the three exemplars, all the shortlisted candidates undergo series of capacity building workshops and individual mentoring plans are conducted to enhance the leadership capacities of the grassroots women leaders. Disaster relief and rehabilitation projects CIIF with the support of CII members have been closely working with the Union and State government to provide relief in disaster-affected geographies across the country. To further enable convergence of humanitarian aid and relief efforts from the corporate sector for efficient and quick response to natural disasters in India, CIIF has also developed an online inventory platform for Disaster Response for Mapping Corporate Sector Resources for disaster relief in India, http://disasterresponse-ciifoundation.in/ CIIF has also been undertaking need-based rehab interventions post natural disasters by converging support of a number of companies in the states of Uttarakhand, Jammu & Kashmir and Tamil Nadu. Projects include livelihood interventions for impacted communities; rebuilding or repair of infrastructure of schools, anganwadis, and hostels; building disaster preparedness of communities. Strengthening the Civil Society Organizations by building capacities and providing facilitative environment to engage with industry CIIF realizes the need for enhancing the capacity of NGOs towards forming, strengthening and sustaining connects with companies. Towards the same, CIIF has been conducting workshops across the country. To further connect NGOs with companies an online platform, Sammaan has been developed in partnership with BSE and IICA. The platform lists NGOS and their projects that can be adopted by companies as part of their CSR programmes. The CIIF has also been undertaking numerous development projects customized to meet the CSR agenda of individual companies. These include programs around providing digital literacy to underprivileged students in schools across three states; improving nutrition and early childhood education at anganwadis; making solar enabled sustainable schools. The work have been supported, appreciated and strengthened by stakeholders from community, government and industry.

ngoList.title: Circle Theatre
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Theatre is a continuous process. Formed in 2002, Circle Theatre is meant for theatre of strength, courage and substance. Having the honour of venue opening and premired in Bharat Rang Mahotsav (the International Theatre Festival of NSD), the USP of the organization is the volume of research oriented work of diverse subject incorporates in its productions which lead to an unique record for this organization within brief span of time in the country that, at a row all of its productions stand at par excellence in terms of its artistic quality, expression and message of these diverse subjects of plays produced by the organization which concerns the greater public interest (see the production list below), which result many times as Best Production of the year of Sahitya Kala Parishad, Govt of NCT Delhi, participated in NSDS International Theatre Festival  Bharat Rang Mahotsav and its Satellite Theatre Festival including other festival of national importance etc. and finally comes to this that in the year of 2009-2010, Circle Theatre, New Delhi is given a Salary Grant (of 10+1) by the Dept. of Culture, Govt. of India. Apart from the main course of activities the circle theatre organizes symposiums and workshops for its actors by inviting resource person from out side for various facets of theatre from time to time which is related to the productions or the individual growth of actors vis-a- vis a systematic practice and training which the organization runs on its own. Circle Theatre offers workshops for others on various subjects of theatre and being invited especially its Artistic Director Mr. Bapi Bose by the various organizations across the country. The organization attends and participates in various theatre festivals, with the objective of using theatre as an instrument for reaching out to people and creating social awareness while simultaneously educating, entertaining and inspiring the masses. Circle Theatre initiates to promote Young Director for new idea of production. The organization provides the Technical Support with their excellent technical team to other organizations whenever it is needed. Circle Theatre is a collaborator and an architect of reviving the citys Bengali theatre culture by involving Sangeet Natak Akademy, New Delhi with New Delhi Kali Bari, Mandir Marg for organizing the National Theatre Festival of Short Plays  All India Bengali Short Drama Competition in 2008 onwards which is become a National Event, a regular cultural feature of citys cultural life in the month of February after Bharat Rang Mahotsav of NSD. For this National event apart from organizing the festival, Circle Theatre has its sharing of responsibilities, introduced the Best Production Award and People Choice Award along with the Exhibition on Theatre, Book Shop for Theatre periodicals and Theatre Books, Ambience Design of the Festival and a Gala Show for Prize Distribution ceremony. The organization does humanitarian work for theatre artistes and others in distress. It brings together actors, writers, set-designers, technicians, singers, puppeteers, graphic, designers, video artistes, film producers, cartoonists and musicians, all of whom comprise its core creative team. In spite of its penetrating appeal to the audience, it has always been difficult to run a professional theatre group like ours. However, with our limited resources we have managed to collect 2000 books on theatre, some of which are really rare. These will be useful for a resource centre on theatre with collection of Books, CDs, Photographs, Interviews etc., which we dream to build with assistance from govt. and other interested agency. THE PRODUCTIONS :- The organization is having a unique record of having five productions which have been judged as Best Productions by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi or participated in various festivals including NSDs International Theatre Festival, called Bharat Rang Mahotsav or International Satellite Theatre Festival of NSD. Socrates (2002) - It is based on Socrates, the great philosopher. Its a contemporary assessment of Autocracy, Freedom of Thought, Freedom of Expression and again upholding the sanctity of Democracy, law & judiciary, communal harmony and national integration. It had the honour of having the premier as the Venue Opening production at 4th Bharat Rang Mahotsav, 2002 etc. Julius Caesar Ke Aakhri Saat Din (2003) & revival in 2008 - A play against Autocracy, War in comparison to the sanctity of Democracy, based on the Great dictator Julius Caesar. It questions about the defence of the country, the society, the culture, the religion, the democracy, the independence and the human rights. But upon establishing in the power the leaders forget the welfare of the people and the society  the human rights are killed first instead. Then what is the way out of such predicament for human society? In the last 2000 years all Caesars are busy building their personal property much than anything else. Participated in international theatre festival, 10th Bharat Rang Mahotsav, 2008 etc. Ekla Chalo Re (2004) - A play on partition, Gandhis assassination and following incidents. Now half a century after that eventful moment we are once again at the arc of a dramatic historical moment where the divisive forces are raising their heads all over again. Introspection of those events in this dramatic work acts as a reminder for those who cares fort the unity of the country and for those who do not care. It talks about the communal harmony and the national integration. Best Production by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, participated in international theatre festival, 7th Bharat Rang Mahotsav, 2005, participated in Best Plays of the Year, 2005 organized by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi etc.. Pratham Parth (2006) -  Based on dexterous episode of Mahabharat and a subaltern introspection of Karn, the Great warrior. If Karns childhood would have been normal, well nurtured, the story of Mahabharat would have been different. The premise is its a case of lost childhood so take care of your little child dont push them away. Best Production by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, participated in international theatre festival - 9th Bharat Rang Mahotsav, 2007 and its Satellite Theatre Festival participated in Best Plays of the Year, 2007 organized by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi etc. Parampurush (2008) - A contemporary introspection of Sri Ramakrishna Paramhamsadev, the embodiment of the harmony of world religions and Swami Vivekananda. The play looks into the man who could transform the mutual hatred to mutual love with the philosophy of Shiv Gyan Me Jeev Seva. Nothing could resist him to preach that Lord Shiva is living in the souls of the every human being. Now despite of Ramakrishnas unique message after Mumbai blast the message of the play becomes so relevant to the Indian society especially and as well as the Global terrorism too. Best Production by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, honour of having the premier at Mohan Rakesh Natya Samaroh, organized by Sahitya Kala Parishad; Govt of NCT; Delhi, 2009, and honour of having the premier of Venue Opening production at 12th Bharat Rang Mahotsav, 2010 etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We are running a centre in Begumpur in South Delhi where we teach almost 150 children. We provide them with free tuition/coaching, vocational training and other extra curricular activities like dance and theatre. We also run a library for them. In Uttarakhand we have a centre in Chandranagar where we teach more than 100 children. Children from both centres have done well in recent years and have qualified for JEE, teacher training courses and other college/university level courses. Many students have been successfully and gainfully employed in various sectors.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Workshop on Solar Energy and Science Diplomacy planned to be organized in the month of July 2017 is very important for creating awareness about International Solar Alliance and growth of clean energy.

The Wareness and Capacity Building in Carbon Capture, Storage and Utilization: Towards a Low Carbon Growth Strategy was held for educating and training of youth for taking control measures to reduce environment pollution. Climate Change Research Institute provided opportunity for Academia-industry interaction It has led to a World Class publication of a Book on Carbon Utilization, Malti Goel and M, Sudhakar (Eds) in Green Energy and Technology, by Springer Nature (2017).
The Climate Change Research Institute organized Environment and Climate Change series lectures on Waste Management Strategies, Future Clean Energy Paradigms, Energy

Science diplomacy in foreign policy provides new opportunity for cooperation among the countries. The Climate Change Research Institute organized first Brainstorming on Science Diplomacy in South Asia jointly with Trans-disciplinary Research Center in Sustainability Studies, JNU in IIC on 12th May 2016 . New governance approach for how India can leverage its knowledge and skill to enhance diplomatic relations with South Asia countries was discussed.
